name: Titanium.UI.iOS
doc:
@platform iphone 1.4 @platform ipad 1.4 @editurl https://github.com/appcelerator/titanium_mobile/edit/master/apidoc/Titanium/UI/iOS/iOS.yml

Apple iOS specific UI capabilities. All properties, methods and events in this namespace will only work on Apple iOS devices.

property.name: AD_SIZE_LANDSCAPE
property.doc:
Use with AdView.adSize to specify a banner ad size appropriate for landscape orientations.

@description

Note that fullscreen ads always display in portrait orientation.

@platform iphone 1.8.1 @platform ipad 1.8.1
property.shortDoc:
Use with AdView.adSize to specify a banner ad size
appropriate for landscape orientations. ...

property.name: AD_SIZE_PORTRAIT
property.doc:
Use with AdView.adSize to specify a banner ad size appropriate for portrait orientations.

@description

Note that fullscreen ads always display in portrait orientation.

@platform iphone 1.8.1 @platform ipad 1.8.1
property.shortDoc:
Use with AdView.adSize to specify a banner ad size
appropriate for portrait orientations. ...

property.name: ANIMATION_CURVE_EASE_IN
property.doc: Use with Animation.curve to specify an animation that starts slowly and speeds up.

deprecated.text: Use <Titanium.UI.ANIMATION_CURVE_EASE_IN> instead.

property.shortDoc:
Use with Animation.curve to specify an animation that starts
slowly and speeds up. ...

html_meta.deprecated:
This property has been deprecated since 2.1.0

Use <Titanium.UI.ANIMATION_CURVE_EASE_IN> instead.

property.name: ANIMATION_CURVE_EASE_IN_OUT
property.doc: Use with Animation.curve to specify an animation that starts slowly, and speeds up, then slows down at the end of the animation.

deprecated.text: Use <Titanium.UI.ANIMATION_CURVE_EASE_IN_OUT> instead.

property.shortDoc:
Use with Animation.curve to specify an animation that starts
slowly, and speeds up, then slows down at the end of the...

html_meta.deprecated:
This property has been deprecated since 2.1.0

Use <Titanium.UI.ANIMATION_CURVE_EASE_IN_OUT> instead.

property.name: ANIMATION_CURVE_EASE_OUT
property.doc: Use with Animation.curve to specify an animation that starts quickly, then slows down at the end of the animation.

deprecated.text: Use <Titanium.UI.ANIMATION_CURVE_EASE_OUT> instead.

property.shortDoc:
Use with Animation.curve to specify an animation that starts
quickly, then slows down at the end of the animation. ...

html_meta.deprecated:
This property has been deprecated since 2.1.0

Use <Titanium.UI.ANIMATION_CURVE_EASE_OUT> instead.

property.name: ANIMATION_CURVE_LINEAR
property.doc: Use with Animation.curve to specify an animation that proceeds at a constant rate.

deprecated.text: Use <Titanium.UI.ANIMATION_CURVE_LINEAR> instead.

property.shortDoc:
Use with Animation.curve to specify an animation that proceeds
at a constant rate. ...

html_meta.deprecated:
This property has been deprecated since 2.1.0

Use <Titanium.UI.ANIMATION_CURVE_LINEAR> instead.

property.name: ATTRIBUTE_BACKGROUND_COLOR
property.doc: Use with Attribute.type to specify a background color.

deprecated.text:
3.6.0 Use the constant instead (without the iOS namespace).

Requires: iOS 6.0 and later

@description

Use a color name or hex value for {@link Attribute#property-value}.

See {@link Attribute} for more information.

property.shortDoc: Use with Attribute.type to specify a background color. ...

html_meta.deprecated:
This property has been deprecated

3.6.0 Use the <Titanium.UI.ATTRIBUTE_BACKGROUND_COLOR> constant instead (without the iOS namespace).

Requires: iOS 6.0 and later

@description

Use a color name or hex value for Attribute.value.

See Attribute for more information.

property.name: ATTRIBUTE_BASELINE_OFFSET
property.doc: Use with Attribute.type to apply a different baseline to the text.

deprecated.text:
3.6.0 Use the constant instead (without the iOS namespace).

Requires: iOS 7.0 and later

@description

Set {@link Attribute#property-value} to a number to specify how many pixels to raise or lower the text.

See {@link Attribute} for more information.

property.shortDoc: Use with Attribute.type to apply a different baseline to the text. ...

html_meta.deprecated:
This property has been deprecated

3.6.0 Use the <Titanium.UI.ATTRIBUTE_BASELINE_OFFSET> constant instead (without the iOS namespace).

Requires: iOS 7.0 and later

@description

Set Attribute.value to a number to specify how many pixels to raise or lower the text.

See Attribute for more information.

property.name: ATTRIBUTE_EXPANSION
property.doc: Use with Attribute.type to stretch the text horizontally.

deprecated.text:
3.6.0 Use the constant instead (without the iOS namespace).

Requires: iOS 7.0 and later

@description

Set {@link Attribute#property-value} to a float value to specify how much to stretch the text.

See {@link Attribute} for more information.

property.shortDoc: Use with Attribute.type to stretch the text horizontally. ...

html_meta.deprecated:
This property has been deprecated

3.6.0 Use the <Titanium.UI.ATTRIBUTE_EXPANSION> constant instead (without the iOS namespace).

Requires: iOS 7.0 and later

@description

Set Attribute.value to a float value to specify how much to stretch the text.

See Attribute for more information.

property.name: ATTRIBUTE_KERN
property.doc: Use with Attribute.type to specify kerning (space between characters).

See {@link Attribute} for more information.

html_meta.deprecated:
This property has been deprecated

3.6.0 Use the <Titanium.UI.ATTRIBUTE_KERN> constant instead (without the iOS namespace).

Set Attribute.value to a float value specifying how many pixels to increase the character spacing.

property.name: ATTRIBUTE_LETTERPRESS_STYLE
property.doc: Use with Attribute.value to use a letterpress text effect.

deprecated.text:
3.6.0 Use the constant instead (without the iOS namespace).

Requires: iOS 7.0 and later

@description

Use this constant when {@link Attribute#property-type} is {@link Titanium.UI.iOS#property-ATTRIBUTE_TEXT_EFFECT}.

See {@link Attribute} for more information.

property.shortDoc: Use with Attribute.value to use a letterpress text effect. ...

html_meta.deprecated:
This property has been deprecated

3.6.0 Use the <Titanium.UI.ATTRIBUTE_LETTERPRESS_STYLE> constant instead (without the iOS namespace).

Requires: iOS 7.0 and later

@description

Use this constant when Attribute.type is ATTRIBUTE_TEXT_EFFECT.

See Attribute for more information.

property.name: ATTRIBUTE_LIGATURE
property.doc: Use with Attribute.type to enable or disable ligatures.

deprecated.text:
3.6.0 Use the constant instead (without the iOS namespace).

Requires: iOS 6.0 and later

@description

Set {@link Attribute#property-value} to 1 to enable ligatures, else 0 to disable. Ligatures are only supported on certain fonts.

See {@link Attribute} for more information.

property.shortDoc: Use with Attribute.type to enable or disable ligatures. ...

html_meta.deprecated:
This property has been deprecated

3.6.0 Use the <Titanium.UI.ATTRIBUTE_LIGATURE> constant instead (without the iOS namespace).

Requires: iOS 6.0 and later

@description

Set Attribute.value to 1 to enable ligatures, else 0 to disable. Ligatures are only supported on certain fonts.

See Attribute for more information.

property.name: ATTRIBUTE_LINK
property.doc: Use with Attribute.type to create a link.

deprecated.text:
3.6.0 Use the constant instead (without the iOS namespace).

Requires: iOS 7.0 and later

@description

Set {@link Attribute#property-value} to a URL.

Use the Label's {@link Titanium.UI.Label#event-link link} event to determine when the user triggers a long press (not a click) event on the linked text.

See {@link Attribute} for more information.

property.shortDoc: Use with Attribute.type to create a link. ...

html_meta.deprecated:
This property has been deprecated

3.6.0 Use the <Titanium.UI.ATTRIBUTE_LINK> constant instead (without the iOS namespace).

Requires: iOS 7.0 and later

@description

Set Attribute.value to a URL.

Use the Label's link event to determine when the user triggers a long press (not a click) event on the linked text.

See Attribute for more information.

property.name: ATTRIBUTE_STROKE_COLOR

3.6.0 Use the constant instead (without the iOS namespace).

property.name: ATTRIBUTE_STROKE_WIDTH
property.doc: Use with Attribute.type to specify the width of the stroke text.

deprecated.text:
3.6.0 Use the constant instead (without the iOS namespace).

Requires: iOS 6.0 and later

@description

Set {@link Attribute#property-value} to a float value specifying the size of stroke width as a percentage of the font size. A positive value displays an outline of the charater, while a negative value fills the character.

See {@link Attribute} for more information.

property.shortDoc: Use with Attribute.type to specify the width of the stroke text. ...

html_meta.deprecated:
This property has been deprecated

3.6.0 Use the <Titanium.UI.ATTRIBUTE_STROKE_WIDTH> constant instead (without the iOS namespace).

Requires: iOS 6.0 and later

@description

Set Attribute.value to a float value specifying the size of stroke width as a percentage of the font size. A positive value displays an outline of the charater, while a negative value fills the character.

See Attribute for more information.

property.name: COLOR_GROUP_TABLEVIEW_BACKGROUND
property.doc:
Returns the iOS system texture used to render the background on a group table view.

@description

Corresponds to iOS UIColor groupTableViewBackgroundColor`.

This constant has been deprecated in iOS 6. Group style table views still default to using the standard iOS group table view background texture if no background color is specified. However, specifying this constant explicitly on iOS 6 and above results in a black background color.

Can be used anywhere a color value is required. See also "Colors" in Titanium.UI.

@platform iphone 2.1.0 @platform ipad 2.1.0
property.shortDoc: Returns the iOS system texture used to render the background on a group table view. ...

property.name: COLOR_SCROLLVIEW_BACKGROUND
property.doc: Returns the iOS system texture used to render the area behind scrollable content.

html_meta.removed:
This property has been removed

3.6.0

@description

Corresponds to iOS UIColor scrollViewTexturedBackgroundColor.

Can be used anywhere a color value is required. See also "Colors" in Titanium.UI.

@platform iphone 2.1.0 @platform ipad 2.1.0

property.name: COLOR_UNDER_PAGE_BACKGROUND
property.doc: Returns the iOS system texture used to render the background of a page.

html_meta.removed:
This property has been removed

3.6.0

Requires: iOS 5.0 and later

@description

Corresponds to iOS UIColor underPageBackgroundColor.

Can be used anywhere a color value is required. See also "Colors" in Titanium.UI.

@platform iphone 2.1.0 @platform ipad 2.1.0

property.name: COLOR_VIEW_FLIPSIDE_BACKGROUND
property.doc: Returns the iOS system texture used for the back side of a view while it is being flipped.

html_meta.removed:
This property has been removed

3.6.0

@description

Corresponds to iOS UIColor viewFlipsideBackgroundColor.

Can be used anywhere a color value is required. See also "Colors" in Titanium.UI.

@platform iphone 2.1.0 @platform ipad 2.1.0

property.name: apiName
property.doc:
The name of the API that this proxy corresponds to.

@description

The value of this property is the fully qualified name of the API. For example, Button returns Ti.UI.Button.

@platform android 3.2.0 @platform blackberry 3.2.0 @platform iphone 3.2.0 @platform ipad 3.2.0 @platform mobileweb 3.2.0
property.shortDoc: The name of the API that this proxy corresponds to. ...

property.name: bubbleParent
property.doc:
Indicates if the proxy will bubble an event to its parent.

@description

Some proxies (most commonly views) have a relationship to other proxies, often established by the add() method. For example, for a button added to a window, a click event on the button would bubble up to the window. Other common parents are table sections to their rows, table views to their sections, and scrollable views to their views. Set this property to false to disable the bubbling to the proxy's parent.

@platform android 3.0.0 @platform iphone 3.0.0 @platform ipad 3.0.0
property.shortDoc: Indicates if the proxy will bubble an event to its parent. ...

property.name: lifecycleContainer
property.doc:
The Window or TabGroup whose Activity lifecycle should be triggered on the proxy.

@description

If this property is set to a Window or TabGroup, then the corresponding Activity lifecycle event callbacks will also be called on the proxy. Proxies that require the activity lifecycle will need this property set to the appropriate containing Window or TabGroup.

@platform android 3.6.0
property.shortDoc: The Window or TabGroup whose Activity lifecycle should be triggered on the proxy. ...

method.name: addEventListener
method.doc: Adds the specified callback as an event listener for the named event.

params.name: name
params.doc: Name of the event.

params.name: callback
params.doc: Callback function to invoke when the event is fired.

method.shortDoc: Adds the specified callback as an event listener for the named event. ...

method.name: applyProperties
method.doc:
Applies the properties to the proxy.

@description

Properties are supplied as a dictionary. Each key-value pair in the object is applied to the proxy such that myproxy[key] = value.

params.name: props
params.doc:
A dictionary of properties to apply.

@platform android 3.0.0 @platform blackberry 3.3.0 @platform iphone 3.0.0 @platform ipad 3.0.0 @platform mobileweb 3.0.0

method.shortDoc: Applies the properties to the proxy. ...

method.name: createTransitionAnimation
method.doc:
Creates a transition animation when opening or closing windows in a Titanium.UI.iOS.NavigationWindow or Titanium.UI.Tab.

Requires: iOS 7.0 and later

@description

Use the object returned by this method with the Window's transitionAnimation property.

Supported on iOS 7 and later.

params.name: transition
params.doc: Dictionary specifying the transition animation.

method.shortDoc:
Creates a transition animation when opening or closing windows in a
Titanium.UI.iOS.NavigationWindow or Titanium.UI.Tab. ...

method.name: removeEventListener
method.doc:
Removes the specified callback as an event listener for the named event.

@description

Multiple listeners can be registered for the same event, so the callback parameter is used to determine which listener to remove.

When adding a listener, you must save a reference to the callback function in order to remove the listener later:

var listener = function() { Ti.API.info("Event listener called."); }
window.addEventListener('click', listener);

To remove the listener, pass in a reference to the callback function:

window.removeEventListener('click', listener);

params.name: name
params.doc: Name of the event.

params.name: callback
params.doc: Callback function to remove. Must be the same function passed to addEventListener.

method.shortDoc: Removes the specified callback as an event listener for the named event. ...
